snippet: The Treasury Department says it will allow users of flexible spending accounts for health care to carry up to $500 from one year to the next.
abstract: Treasury Dept says new rule could allow workers who take advantage of special tax-free accounts to pay out-of-pocket medical expenses to carry over up to $500 from one year to the next.
lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department says it will allow users of flexible spending accounts for health care to carry up to $500 from one year to the next.
